Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk brlapi
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: ocaml bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: OCaml is a high-level, strongly-typed, functional, and object-oriented programming language from the ML family of languages. This package contains two batch compilers (a fast bytecode compiler and an optimizing native-code compiler), an interactive top level system, parsing tools (Lex, Yacc, Camlp4), a replay debugger, a documentation generator, and a comprehensive library. The ocaml packages have been upgraded to upstream version 4.01.0, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1098459, BZ#1080015) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, the execshield stack protection was disabled for various binary files in the ocaml packages for IBM Power Systems CPU architectures. With this update, execshield is enabled for all binaries. (BZ#990521) Previously, the virt-builder command incorrectly parsed the input of the "--size" parameter. Consequently, parameters specified after "--size" were not recognized. This bug has been fixed, and virt-builder now parses "--size" as expected. (BZ#1139803) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: The graphviz packages, which provide a collection of tools for the manipulation and layout of graphs, have been rebuild to incorporate changes introduced by the rebase of the ocaml packages. (BZ#1155554) The brltty packages, that contain a background process (daemon) which provides access to the Linux console in text mode using a refreshable braille display, have been rebuild to incorporate changes in the ocaml packages introduced by the rebase. (BZ#1155561) This update adds support for the little-endian variant of IBM Power Systems CPU architecture to the ocaml and graphviz components of the ocaml package. (BZ#1124005, BZ#1125538) Users of ocaml are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
